text:
In http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/programs/rotatelogs.html the documentation for option "-l" says "Note that using -l in an environment which changes the GMT offset (such as for BST or DST) can lead to unpredictable results!"

But the resolution of https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24417 by changeset http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=103973 indicates that it is no longer unpredictable.

I am not sure exactly what versions/branches this would apply to, besides the trunk.
